GUMP GPD Analysis

Observables module

Here we define the GPD ansatz based on the moment space expression norm * x^ alpha * (1-x)^ beta. With the GPDs ansatz, observables with LO evolution are calculated

Observables.ConfWaveFuncG(j: complex, x: float, xi: float) → complex[source]

Gluon conformal wave function p_j(x,xi)

Check e.g. https://arxiv.org/pdf/hep-ph/0509204.pdf

Parameters:

  • j – conformal spin j (actually conformal spin is j+2 but anyway)

  • x – momentum fraction x

  • xi – skewness parameter xi

Returns:

gluon conformal wave function p_j(x,xi)

Observables.ConfWaveFuncQ(j: complex, x: float, xi: float) → complex[source]

Quark conformal wave function p_j(x,xi)

Check e.g. https://arxiv.org/pdf/hep-ph/0509204.pdf

Parameters:

  • j – conformal spin j (conformal spin is actually j+2 but anyway)

  • x – momentum fraction x

  • xi – skewness parameter xi

Returns:

quark conformal wave function p_j(x,xi)

Observables.Flv_Intp(Flv_array: array, flv)[source]

Flv_array: (N, 3) complex flv: (N) str

return result: (N) complex

class Observables.GPDobserv(init_x: float, init_xi: float, init_t: float, init_Q: float, p: int)[source]

Bases: object

CFF(ParaAll, muset, p_order=1, flv='All')[source]

Charge averged CFF $mathcal{F}(xi, t) (mathcal{F} = Q_u^2 F_u + Q_d^2 F_d)$

Parameters:

  • [Para_Forward (ParaAll =)

  • Para_xi2

  • Para_xi4]

  • [Para_Forward_uV (Para_Forward =)

  • Para_Forward_ubar

  • Para_Forward_dV

  • Para_Forward_dbar

  • Para_Forward_g]

  • Para_Forward_i – forward parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • [Para_xi2_uV (Para_xi2 =)

  • Para_xi2_ubar

  • Para_xi2_dV

  • Para_xi2_dbar

  • Para_xi2_g]

  • Para_xi2_i – xi^2 parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • [Para_xi4_uV (Para_xi4 =)

  • Para_xi4_ubar

  • Para_xi4_dV

  • Para_xi4_dbar

  • Para_xi4_g]

  • Para_xi4_i – xi^4 parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

Returns:

CFF mathcal{F}(xi, t) = Q_u^2 F_u + Q_d^2 F_d

GFFj0(j: int, flv, ParaAll, p_order)[source]

Generalized Form Factors A_{j0}(t) which is the xi^0 term of the nth (n= j+1) Mellin moment of GPD int dx x^j F(x,xi,t) for quark and int dx x^(j-1) F(x,xi,t) for gluon

Note for gluon, GPD reduce to x*g(x), not g(x) so the Mellin moment will have a mismatch

Only leading order implemented yet NOT well-maintained (TO BE FIXED)

GPD(flv, ParaAll, p_order=1)[source]

GPD F(x, xi, t) in flavor space (flv = “u”, “d”, “S”, “NS” or “g”)

Parameters:

  • [Para_Forward (ParaAll =)

  • Para_xi2

  • Para_xi4]

  • [Para_Forward_uV (Para_Forward =)

  • Para_Forward_ubar

  • Para_Forward_dV

  • Para_Forward_dbar

  • Para_Forward_g]

  • Para_Forward_i – forward parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • [Para_xi2_uV (Para_xi2 =)

  • Para_xi2_ubar

  • Para_xi2_dV

  • Para_xi2_dbar

  • Para_xi2_g]

  • Para_xi2_i – xi^2 parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • [Para_xi4_uV (Para_xi4 =)

  • Para_xi4_ubar

  • Para_xi4_dV

  • Para_xi4_dbar

  • Para_xi4_g]

  • Para_xi4_i – xi^4 parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • p_order – 1 for leading-order evolution (default); 2 for next-to-leading-order evolution ; higher order not implemented yet

Returns:

f(x,xi,t) for given flavor flv

TFF(ParaAll, muf, meson, p_order=1, flv='All')[source]

TFF $mathcal{F}(xi, t) (mathcal{F}$

Parameters:

  • [Para_Forward (ParaAll =)

  • Para_xi2

  • Para_xi4]

  • [Para_Forward_uV (Para_Forward =)

  • Para_Forward_ubar

  • Para_Forward_dV

  • Para_Forward_dbar

  • Para_Forward_g]

  • Para_Forward_i – forward parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • [Para_xi2_uV (Para_xi2 =)

  • Para_xi2_ubar

  • Para_xi2_dV

  • Para_xi2_dbar

  • Para_xi2_g]

  • Para_xi2_i – xi^2 parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • [Para_xi4_uV (Para_xi4 =)

  • Para_xi4_ubar

  • Para_xi4_dV

  • Para_xi4_dbar

  • Para_xi4_g]

  • Para_xi4_i – xi^4 parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • rho (meson = [1 for)

  • phi (2 for)

  • jpsi] (3 for)

  • p_order – 1 for leading-order evolution (default); 2 for next-to-leading-order evolution ; higher order not implemented yet

  • "u" ((flv =)

  • "d"

  • "g"

  • "q") ("All" or)

Returns:

TFF mathcal{F}(xi, t)

TFFNLO(ParaAll, muf: float, meson: int, flv='All')[source]

TFF $mathcal{F}(xi, t) (mathcal{F}$

  • Para_xi2

  • Para_xi4]

  • Para_Forward_ubar

  • Para_Forward_dV

  • Para_Forward_dbar

  • Para_Forward_g]

  • Para_Forward_i – forward parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • [Para_xi2_uV (Para_xi2 =)

  • Para_xi2_ubar

  • Para_xi2_dV

  • Para_xi2_dbar

  • Para_xi2_g]

  • Para_xi2_i – xi^2 parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • [Para_xi4_uV (Para_xi4 =)

  • Para_xi4_ubar

  • Para_xi4_dV

  • Para_xi4_dbar

  • rho (meson = [1 for)

  • phi (2 for)

  • jpsi] (3 for)

  • results (muset = offset of scale mu to study the scale dependence of the)

  • "u" ((flv =)

  • "d"

  • "g"

  • "q") ("All" or)

Returns:

TFF mathcal{F}(xi, t)

  • Para_Forward_ubar

  • Para_Forward_dV

  • Para_Forward_dbar

  • Para_Forward_g]

  • Para_Forward_i – forward parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • [Para_xi2_uV (Para_xi2 =)

  • Para_xi2_ubar

  • Para_xi2_dV

  • Para_xi2_dbar

  • Para_xi2_g]

  • Para_xi2_i – xi^2 parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • [Para_xi4_uV (Para_xi4 =)

  • Para_xi4_ubar

  • Para_xi4_dV

  • Para_xi4_dbar

  • Para_xi4_g]

  • Para_xi4_i – xi^4 parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • rho (meson = [1 for)

  • phi (2 for)

  • jpsi] (3 for)

  • results (muset = offset of scale mu to study the scale dependence of the)

  • "u" ((flv =)

  • "d"

  • "g"

  • "q") ("All" or)

Returns:

TFF mathcal{F}(xi, t)

tPDF(flv, ParaAll, p_order=1)[source]

t-denpendent PDF for given flavor (flv = “u”, “d”, “S”, “NS” or “g”)

Parameters:

  • [Para_Forward (ParaAll =)

  • Para_xi2]

  • [Para_Forward_uV (Para_Forward =)

  • Para_Forward_ubar

  • Para_Forward_dV

  • Para_Forward_dbar

  • Para_Forward_g]

  • Para_Forward_i – parameter sets for valence u quark (uV), sea u quark (ubar), valence d quark (dV), sea d quark (dbar) and gluon (g)

  • Para_xi2 – only matter for non-zero xi (NOT needed here but the parameters are passed for consistency with GPDs)

  • p_order – 1 for leading-order evolution (default); 2 for next-to-leading-order evolution ; higher order not implemented yet

Returns:

f(x,t) in for the given flavor

Observables.InvMellinWaveFuncG(s: complex, x: float) → complex[source]

Gluon wave function for inverse Mellin transformation: x^(-s+1) for x>0 and 0 for x<0

Parameters:

  • s – Mellin moment s (= n)

  • x – momentum fraction x

Returns:

x^(-s+1) for x>0 and 0 for x<0

Return type:

Gluon wave function for inverse Mellin transformation

Observables.InvMellinWaveFuncQ(s: complex, x: float) → complex[source]

Quark wave function for inverse Mellin transformation: x^(-s) for x>0 and 0 for x<0

Parameters:

  • s – Mellin moment s (= n)

  • x – momentum fraction x

Returns:

x^(-s) for x>0 and 0 for x<0

Return type:

Wave function for inverse Mellin transformation

vectorized version of InvMellinWaveFuncQ

Observables.flv_to_indx(flv: str)[source]

flv is the flavor. It is a string

This function will cast each flavor to an auxiliary length 3 array

Output shape: scalar int

Observables.flvmask(flv: str)[source]
Observables.flvs_to_indx(flvs)[source]

flvs is an array of strings (N) Output: (N)
